verbatim_example: In less than 3 weeks I'll be a year clean.

I quit everything about a year and a half ago with the help of a detox place. I relapsed by starting to use Kratom and then ventured into RC benzos as a way to get off Kratom, but of course that spiraled into abusing both and graduating to harder opiates as well as filling my adderall script.
I quit opiates/benzos/adderall 12 days ago, now I am trying to stabilize on Kratom. ... I get so easily over-whelmed, and that feeling is really magnified when I stop dosing.
Now after 3 weeks I am back in that place I was months ago. Sometimes I think a work routine, being around co-workers, etc will be good to establish before jumping off all the way.
But I'm 4 months sober and know my life is going in the positive direction.
So, as some of you read I've been 4 months sober. I'm doing better now with my cravings.
I've only got 5 months but I'm telling you. I'm so excited to wake up each day doing something I love. Helping other addicts who are suffering.
How can I get the best bang for my buck with them? I'd usually take 2 and snort a half of one for a fast, hard come up and a pretty long high. Is there's a better way for me to dose these?

Started with Narco 10s in highschool, worked my way up to pink oxys, then A 214s, then A 215s, and you know how it goes. Now I'm in college and I love the rush and buzz from railing a roxy and popping 2 more,
haven't had any opis in months
I want to thank everyone who sent me a private message. Honestly, I couldn't do it without you guys. I have been to a couple of meeting.
I feel alive for the first time in 10 yrs. I've been hitting meetings.
Now that I am clean, I can barely get out of bed bc back and knees are so bad.
I am scared bc I know I am new in my recovery.
I don't even remember how it's done. I am happy to be here, sober .
When we met, I was very upfront about my recovery.
Not this year. I celebrated by not using.
I know you're not medical professionals, but I know I have everything I need to detox at home.
I have been taking kratom since Tuesday to help withdrawal.
Six months ago I couldn't even go 60 minutes without having to use something.
Six months and some change ago I couldn't even go 60 minutes without having to use something to change the way I feel. This is the only period of sobriety I've had in 10 years.
Anyone down for a recovery fantasy league? I used to run one in r/opiates but figured I could get some people who actually could participate in the entire season through this sub.

I’ve gotten two jobs (one of which was my dream job of teaching). I’ve moved out of my parents house into my own place. I have a girlfriend and am in an actual healthy relationship for the first time in my life. I lost 60 lbs of body fat, stopped all blood pressure meds, max bench: 375 squat:395 dead: 455 overhead:225. I love myself and actually have some sort of self esteem. My relationship with my family is the best it’s ever been. I actually pay bills now and manage money.
a year ago I was in a hospital bed with a Staff Infection and Pneumonia; I was making plans to go pick up the second I got out...What a difference a year can make.
I’m officially one year clean from opiates.
It's day 3 off of a 8 day relapse. Came clean to everyone I know (all very supportive) Been a closet oxy user for years... had some good clean time before lapsing the last 8 days prior to Saturday.
Despite what stage you're in, just know that whatever time you have cleared, you never have to do that part again.
Physically, most of everything has passed.
One week down, working on day 8.
Eight days down, moving into day 9.
I'm wrapping up day 11 in a few hours and figured I'd spew some shit out about progress that might help someone.

This shit isn't easy... but that shouldn't be the reason you don't stop using. It's not supposed to be easy, you're trying to rescue your hijacked brain and body from something that's held it hostage for however long.

Coming up on two weeks later today. I feel like I can remember every second that's passed by. Good - Don't feel like last week. Getting a lot of exercise. Haven't missed a day of work. Sleep is trying to return slowly. Not as many emotional spells. Appetite is coming back (especially after exercise). Getting a lot of shit taken care of. Saving money.

This past weekend was better than the last. Got a lot of exercise in, bunch of stuff done around the house, went to an early dinner with my wife, cooked for the week and just hung out with some friends.

Closing in on 3 weeks, Feeling better every day, looking forward to maybe sleeping in this weekend? Whatever the fuck that means. I'm waiting for that one night where I just conk out for 8-9 hours so bad.

Symptoms at 3 weeks out... broken sleep of 4-6 hours, morning shits (a very zen one this morning at least), anhedonia waves, come and go restless limbs. Hoping some of the above starts to clear out over the next week.
I started to think I was coming out of the fog for a bit. Nevertheless, I weathered the storm and I'm looking at a fresh week 4 ahead of me.
Only things lingering around at 25 days are morning GI, restless sleep, anxiety/anhedonia waves. I think it's gradually getting better but it feels sort of consistent over the last few days.
I've gone this long. I feel so much better than I thought I would.
I've now gone five days without
I have been off heroin for six days now, but last night and this morning i had an incredibly bad toothache. I mean I was literally writing in my bed in pain.
I haven't been using for almost two months.
Hang in there. It gets better.
Day 2. I'm struggling. But better than expected. If I don't make it I'll lose everything.
Every. Minute. Every. Hour. Each one is one closer to being better.
I feel so much better than just yesterday. I think I can do this.
Thats enough. I cant fucking do that anymore. It is humiliating. Degrading. I dont want in the least to be that person.
This is the longest I've been sober in a year at least.
Seven days. One week. I've made it this far.
I had a major car accident and relapsed. In back to 3days. Need encouragement. Please
It's been a month and a half. I feel alive. I just got a new girlfriend... It's amazing how much my life has changed for the better.
I've been taking opiates for about 2 years now, usually only on the weekends. I normaly take about 8-10    10/325 hydrocodone, make poppy seed tea, or if I'm lucky take a few oxy.
Anyways, at anytime I keep at least 40 pounds of poppyseeds incase the site I order from gets shut down, or something gets lost in the male, by doing this, I haven't WD'd in close to 2 years,
I'm going to get totally straight hamstered!
I'm going to take my 60 day chip today. I'm actually looking forward to it, rather than mocking the whole process.
I've got 4 months clean and sober - the idea of being in pain just riles me up. I know that there is no chance in hell that I can have any opiates without coming unhinged.

I wanted to thank all of you who responded to my previous post and encourage anyone who may read this another day. We can do it, and it's not shameful to be afraid and work through that fear with others.
I'm writing this and calling my sponsor today so that I'm honest, and keeping myself accountable.

The fact that time is so universally important in recovery can be beyond frustrating and discouraging, because you can't buy it (as we are used to doing with things we want and/or need), and you can't do anything else except to wait in order to have it. Early in recovery the thoughts of using are so non-stop that it feels as if this is never going to change.
I encourage anyone who wants to make that change to realize that you already do know, in your heart, that you are fully capable of changing.
Myself as well as the large majority of opiate users I have met along my journey through recovery all have almost the same story.
I was in recovery, and actually a year or so into it at that point... things will work out. You know you’re ready to make that step towards getting clean.
Clean for over two years... Why am I still searching this shit.
I've been clean for two years, and my drug of choice is and always will be heroin. I haven't tried to get any dope, or even any painkillers.
The worst thing about a craving is that when I get one, it's not for a fuckin vicodin or two, but a needle and a bundle of downs. Ugh. Clenching my teeth lately.
I've been clean for two years, but have been jonesin hard lately...
Looking too damn healthy after two years clean.
I haven't touched an opiate in over two years, haven't shot up in almost three...
So I am about 90-100 days clean. It’s the most clean time I’ve had and I seriously couldn’t be happier.
I woke up this morning with a call from my sponsors girlfriend - he passed away today. Young dude, had so much going for him, 3 years clean and used once and now he’s gone.
Recovery is hard. I just have to remember I'm on the right path right now.
I'm in sober living(not exactly my choice) and they do a couple types of drug screenings.
I've been sober for 13 months this coming Friday, my son is almost 8 weeks old, I'm gaining so much in my life and I'm actually happy, so why do I still want to get high?
I’m also currently in sober living due to my conditions of release/deferred disposition and will have just over 2 years clean when I can leave here.
7/18/16 was the day I actually got sober. The 17th was the last time I had a shot of heroin.
I am on day 15 without Heroin.
I no i need to pick myself up as soon as i can.
So i fucked up the other day and went back to heroin.
Im 1 week heroin free. Not feel well today
Today i am 15 days off heroin.
Today i am at day 20 heroin and alcohol free.
Today is 34 days without heroin and alcohol. Day 34 Heroin free
Im day 39 heroin and alcohol free.
Today i am on day 50 heroin and alcohol free.  i have never made it this far before with heroin and alcohol.
I relapsed yesterday thought using was better than going and killing myself.my heads like y did i ever quit sure i wa t to quit but idk
Im on day two without heroin. I been in the bathroom all day puking and shitting.
I am day 10 off heroin and alcohol been in hospital (was brought in there the other day) for dehydration and withdrawals.
I am on day 15 off heroin.
I am 23 days off alcohol and 27 off Heroin. That is good as i plan to keep the days going up :)
I have been in rehab for the passed 3 months. I am two days out and i am living in a house with other clean and sober ppl.
I'll also add that in 5 days clean right now, but on my 3rd attempt (longest was 17 days) since Jan., so physically feeling pretty alright.
I'm feeling pretty good, and every day is GETTING BETTER. I've been hitting my outpatient program super hard, 1 on 1 every Tuesday and group 3 times a week.
You know in recovery, how they talk about that moment where it clicks? Well I had one of those.  At that moment, nothing mattered except for recovery.

With only 60 days clean myself, I think I'm a little jealous that other opiate addicts are still using mind altering chemicals. In some weird way, I wish I could sill drink or smoke or take other pills, and those suppressed longings are turning into something different.
Just curious to know how many meetings do you go to per week (if any), and how much clean time do you have?
For me, I think I would wish for my own place. Living with my parents is alright, but I feel like it's holding me back from being independent (which I feel is an important part of recovery).
"...it's about staying self aware and in the moment which is a huge part of recovery and growing as a person."
So I'm 25 and I get my 90 days 100% sober this week... Everything in me is feeling her back except for... MY FUCKING RECOVERY.
Life keeps on getting better. My life is filled with so much love instead of the bullshit it was filled with for so long.
100+ days later and I've been to at least one meeting pretty much every day. I'm pretty confident I'd be using if it wasn't for NA.
I have four months clean today... Recovery is possible.

I guess I am still addicted to chaos. This does not mean that I'm not grateful for everything that I now have, I just really feel like I'm a ticking time bomb and that in any second I'll just go back to my old ways.
I just wanted to tell you guys that this is my first sober Halloween in 5 years!

To anyone who is in early recovery, I want to tell you that it is possible to enjoy life without drugs. I didn't believe it was possible a few months ago but as time went on and I began going to meetings and realizing what life was really about was when I became happier.

Today I’ve got 90 days. 90 days ago I was sitting in the IOP program at the Betty Ford Center stung out of my mind with twenty dollars in my pocket anxiously waiting for it to be over that day so that my friend and I could go score yet again.
Somebody asked me a dosage question, because their dose is not working. I told them to ask a doctor because I was not sure about it.
Have almost 15 days clean now and I notice recovery has been getting harder and harder for me the more i relapse.

So today I have 252 days clean (8 months 8 days). 5 of those months I spent in a behavior corrections facility or "TC". I'm also in a drug court probation program. My alternative sentence is 7 years w/ an 85% in state prison. So its safe to say I take my recovery very seriously.
I've decided to quit opiates starting tomorrow after eight months of use...

For all of you who've decided to as of tomorrow, good for you and feel free to PM me if you need something or just want to talk to someone. I'm currently finishing up my fifth day sober-ish (on xanax rn) and through the worst of the physical WDs.
I won't have access to any more for at least a week. I'm forcing myself to detox from a pretty large opiate habit, and my biggest problem except time I try to quit is the boredom.
I quit dope about a month ago and have had really bad PAWS
I was heavily addicted to heroin last year but have been clean since June 14. I used trams again today but I’m afraid that using too much will only make it worse.
I haven’t posted at all in a while but I’ve been clean off of all drugs for 39 days.
I haven’t posted at all in a while but I’ve been clean off of all drugs for 39 days.
45 days clean today and it’s been kinda rough lately.

I feel that going through the withdrawals combined with not having any crutches will give me some enlightenment and allow me to completely focusing on recovery instead of worrying about my next nic fix.
Has anyone tried snorting dope and coke?
It's been nearly two years since I stopped injecting oxy, oxymorphone, hydromorphone, morphine, and anything else really.
Disclaimer I do not abuse this my health insurance fucked me and can no longer see my psychiatrist so I took matters in my own hands.
I don't know what it is but I am feeling extremely hopeless right now. Like nothing's going right.

As of October 12th I was officially two years sober...I'd like to thank some of you guys in here for being awesome and talking to me when I've been having a rough time and just keeping me on track. So if anyone needs some advice or just simply to talk to whether it's about getting clean or just how your day's going send me a message.
Slowly saving back up to rebuild it now that I'm sober.
I'd like to spread the goodness with anyone who's trying to get clean or struggling to stay clean.
To all reading this looking for help or inspiration you CAN do it, trust me if I can, anyone can.
I'm having a few potential issues I'm a bit worried about... Does anyone think this is related to the opiate quitting again?
I'm currently 15 days clean off PST and wanted to post an update. ... Hoping I didn't do any permanent damage and it will come back.
I've got about 3 weeks clean off a 2 year PST habit of about 2 lbs a day.
5 weeks off a pretty heavy PST habit, getting back in to therepy and had some concerns.

12 year off and on opiate user with ~3 years as longest clean time, coming of my longest everyday using time of 2+ years (starting 300g poppy seeds/day, going to 2.5lbs seeds/day) ... GI issues better now (4 mos. clean).
I've got about 6 months clean from an on/off whenever I could get it(percs>oxys>heroin>oxys>poppy seeds>heroin>oxy you get it) habit over last 12 years.
So I come here looking for support again, just as I did about a year ago today when I got clean.
I am sober. I am alive. I am incredibly grateful.
End of day seven, goddamn bastard 14-hour workday is done. Bye-bye Egghead U, I'm going the hell home to a bath (my back!) and some sleep. Hold on guys, we can kick this shit! One. Week. CLEAN!
When I kicked opiates I also kicked caffeine, and I haven't had a drink in a long time. And I promise myself that after the hell of withdrawal I will never go down that road again.
Still free and clear... My body is like an old, tired sock... I keep wanting to stretch out, shake and use my muscles a bit. I'm so weak, it's been years.
I have been clean for two weeks now. No opiates. No drinking. No caffeine.

I'm doing it, guys, one day at a time. Oh, and, by the by... the family is planning a big trip for this summer. Our first EVER vacation together. And I plan to be one super-sober traveller, apart from maybe an occasional glass of wine,
Three weeks ago I was in hell. My body went through an absolute horror show of pain. Fever, shakes, nausea, muscle cramps... insomnia, jesus.
Four weeks. I am clean, I am alive, I am beginning to feel comfortable in my skin.
I do not want to be a junkie thank you very much. Stupid intrusive thought, fuck was I mad.
I am five weeks sober. Grouchy, tired, but desperately glad to be alive.
I think about using and reason it out. It makes no sense to go back. I feel pretty good, day to day. My energy and mood are improving, I'm more observant, alert, attentive, I want to DO things.
I am still weak, it's a long road back. I think about using sometimes, I do recognize that I am not immune to that pull... but I don't.
I have been clean for ten weeks and three days -- I genuinely lost track.

I'm fine. Every day is just a day now. I don't wake up in agony, thinking about a fix constantly. I just... live. Sometimes it's boring. I trudge through. I am alive, mostly happy and I know I am no longer slowly killing myself.

Last year I checked myself into rehab for the 2nd time, almost a year exact from the first time I went to rehab... My first month or 2 out of rehab I opened up Google Calendar and I scheduled every single thing I was going to be doing for the week, and I stuck to it. ...Today marks 1 year of Sobriety.

None of the comments in this video's discussion mention recovery, but the title suggests that the content may discuss addiction and potentially recovery. However, upon reviewing the video description, it appears to be a general educational video about addiction rather than a personal account or discussion of recovery.
I have two years sober today... Sobriety is fucking crazy. 2 years feels like 10... and it keeps getting better.
I got sober in 2014. A year later we reconnected. I helped get him County funding to get into rehab.

I have achieved so many things these past 3 years I would have never dreamed I'd be doing. I was addicted to opiates for almost 10 years and in the beginning of 2018 a bank is going to give me 250k to buy a house.
I am 8 months sober from a heavy heroin habit.
I want to want to get clean but it's hard to see it.
I haven't touched an opiate in almost 5 months.
Don't believe i've posted but I could be wrong. Anyways I've been pretty into opes for a while, never enough to get a full blown habit but still a fair bit.
I'd be interested in smoking instead of shooting but I find it gets me so nauseous that I don't even feel high. Anyone else have this experience or some advice?
I'm kicking my first one month habit, between a half and full point a day. Wds have been easy but at this stage is it too late to get back to baseline?
I kicked my h habit about 3 weeks ago and haven’t had the urge to use more than every now and then since
Clean for 3 months, made this song .
it's about my mindset when I was using.
Will this set me back in my recovery.
I'm over the worst why go right back. I'm just feeling trapped and depressed.
when you feel you need to get out at moments of clarity and joy let it happen to let the Trick know what they have been missing. It doesn't have to be 24hr lockdown after the initial withdrawls.

I feel like a have finally visualized a real life and what that is suppose to be composed of. I can now honestly say that I am ready to have a actual life and not this puppet show I have been putting on for everyone.
I have a long way to go I know. But it does feel good to not have opiates pumping through me.
Feeling sooo much better. Sleep is still shit. But hit a meeting last night, great topics. Feeling good today, hopeful. Conversations are easier, crawling my ass out of bed is easier.

Didn't get to spend much time with her, but the joy I saw on her face when I wished her a happy birthday before anything else and her knowing it was sincere and that I am sober was great motivation for the day. And her saying I gave her the greatest birthday gift by being sober.
Stay clean. Shit tends to work out in the end.
I genuinely feel like I'm almost back to who I was before the opiates took over my life.

Tried to cold turkey approx 8mg sub last year went a month clean and I just couldn't bear it anymore.
Two weeks ago I gave a short 7 sub taper a try. I switched to kratom for about 2 months.( was previously on sub). Using about 30g of kratom a day to maintain so I had a bit of a heft habit. 
Took the subs for 7 days, still felt a bit strange during that time. Probably the kratom withdrawal under the subs.

To anyone out there who is on day 1 week 1 week 2 etc. I know how INSURMOUNTABLE it seems. But I PROMISE YOU if you just STAY THE FUCK AWAY FROM OPIATES, and have a vision of what you want your life to look like. It WILL fall into place.
Long story short, it's been about 4 months off opiates and I have done it without any real support system besides my girlfriend and family.
I ran out of my meds soon after I got out and am continuing to heal up, find a job and change my life around. It's been 4 days since I did any opiates and hope I can continue to stay sober.
I figured it was time to stop. Lope definitely helped my withdrawals the first three days and then when I woke up on the 4th day, I felt completely fine.

Starting all over now. Day 3. My withdrawals are never really that bad besides the sleep problem but I just take two extremely high doses of loperamide each 48 hours apart and before I know it i'm clear of the withdrawals
I just got out of my 2nd stint in rehab today and my mother is sooo supportive. I am now 23 and feel like I need to get it right this time; I know I do not want to pick up.

Well today I sat in my room, usually takes me 10 to 15 minutes to completely focus my thoughts on my breathing as I do mainly concentration breathing. ... I have meditated on and off, usually when I had a steady supply of heroin. Was doing a bundle a day but now im 24 days clean
So I have been clean now from heroin, well from everything including cigarettes for 40 days.

So I sure as hell would not have been outside being as cold as it is but shit I am sober now and decided to take my dog to the lake...I would not have been outside and saw that duck if the cosmos did not align in such a way for me to stay sober now for 6 weeks and 3 days.
This got me happy about my future and I could see how listening to this may help those earlier in recovery.
......damn, was a dark individual during those times. hahaha, I can't even believe I wrote that considering the change within my self over this past year.
On to rehab, it was my second one. The first one I planned on using as soon as I got out and I did. This one I wanted to but at the same time, I can't do this to my mother anymore.
This withdrawal thing didn’t work so good in the past, but I really think this time is the one I’m gonna be able to come out on the other side. As a free man.
Off to rehab tomorrow, I have done everything to get clean the last 6 months, but after a few years of shootn dope every day, I am too deep in to make it to the other side by myself.
I survived day 1 (today) easy, I have no idea why I tried to do it myself 50 times when I should have come here right away. They make the W 80% better, I am at day 3 of W  but it feels like day 1.
Would like to support someone dealing with heroin addiction
However I feel like my personality is back, I have dreams (goals), and feel pleasure from doing stuff again like listening to music and shit, which is awesome
I have been clean now. Five days ago I did two shots of heroin before I fell asleep... How is that even possible? Can I never become a chipper?
I made a post about taking a small shot in the middle of my wd, and I am soo glad I did cuz yea I had to start the wd all over but it is like 1/3 painfull so I am actually enjoying myself.
Being clean is hard but if I keep it up mabye some day I won’t have to keep fighting the urge to use or to kill myself.
Plan on taking 16mgs. I am an IV user and was probably shooting up half a gram to gram of heroin a day or 3 to 8 diluadeds a day.
Got myself 2 Ds earlier. DId one and am supposed to save the other. Thing is that I am not that high. Want it for the morning.
I'm driving from NY to FL and want to get high while driving but thinking it can be dangerous. Maybe only get a touch high?
I probably would need to shoot 2 1/2 for reference. Is it possible if maybe I sniff 5 to get high?
What options do I have, as in cleansers and all that shit?
I want to quit now while I am still ahead to some extent and get back to my meetings and do the deal.
So far I made it about two and a half days, last dose was Wednesday afternoon. ... So I am basically going to go through it this time and need some support from you guys again to get through it.
So far I made it about two and a half days, last dose was Wednesday afternoon. ... So I am basically going to go through it this time and need some support from you guys again to get through it.
On day 7!!!!!, in the next 12 hours or so I will oficially have a week clean. The only WD symtoms I am still having is the sleep, only got 3 hours of sleep last night.
This is not my first rodeo with recovery though, but my first time getting clean without rehab( just got kicked off my moms insurance).
Just hit day 8 of quitting so I have been officially clean for a week now.
I'm finally over the physical withdraws, which is great.
I'm close to the end of day 12 of being sober and I am extremely stressed about going to work. I'm shaking as I'm writing this.
I need to open up to people a lot more about how I feel and that I’m struggling. Today is day 1 after coming off a two week run.

I can’t seem to get back on board with recovery... all I am really asking is that if there is anybody nice enough that would be willing to text with me while I go through withdrawal, especially during them hard days at work so I don’t feel so alone.
I am not going to go back and accept I made a mistake but did I just put myself back at day one again of withdraws?

I did a three day sub taper which helped out but seemed to prolong the WD process. And working through this and trying to function as a normal human being has been the hardest thing I ever done especially when my sub taper was over.
I’m closing in on about two weeks clean and I still can’t sleep to save my life. It’s starting to become a quality of life issue at this point.
I’m closing in on about two weeks clean and I still can’t sleep to save my life.

I’ve been clean for 2 weeks and relapsed last night by snorting two stamp bags of heroin (ecp). Im just chulking it up as a one night thing and will continue to stay clean going forward and hopefully learn from this slip up.
What do you do to stay clean?
Im 24 hours in right now and feel quite terrible. My dealer always told me if I ever wanted to quit he would completely cut me off and I finally gave him the word and he completely cut me off lol.
If something does not make me happy I'm changing it.
Once you got clean, how long did it take to feel like your was brain was pumping out them juices again?
I’m clean now with 25 days sober
Anyone on here right now that is sober or looking to get sober willing to talk?
I’m newly clean (got 10 days completely sober), and need help with my car (one of my main using spots).
Been clean for about 45 days and my guy just hit me up for the first time.
I told them I contemplated going cold turkey after only 2 days worth of methadone, what should I do?
We're homeless now. With 20 bucks to my pocket and one gram.
What is the best medicine for withdrawaling to ease the symptoms?
I've only used shit ppl gave me so I'm not familiar with the terminology for getting them.
My main question here for my people in recovery is what significant or little changes have you noticed in yourself?
Now that I'm sober I can never understand how people can function every day with a opiate addiction. Like being dope sick and needing to be high having lil to no money?
You know what really sucks. That both your plugs pick up the same h and its been complete shit for the past month so now im sitting here sniffing blues like a god damn retard.
Does anyone else like to indulge in a few beers after a nice fat shot.
Luckily I've only been using everyday for about 3 weeks, but fuck. I'm 24 hours into withdraw and it's tough. I have to say I don't feel as bad, physically, as I did when coming off oxy.
I started a real program today. It's my first day sober, again.
This is my first sober weekend so I'm staying busy. I went last night to my first NA meeting in years and it was awesome! Met some great people and ran into an old friend.
It's day 5 for me, got to sleep in today which was nice, slept for about 9 hours. I'm really bored. Just counting down the hours till my 8 o clock meeting.
Today is day 13 for me! This is the longest I've been sober since summer 2011, and first time I'm really sober.
It's day 20 for me. Tomorrow will be 3 weeks sober, which is incredible to me. This is already the most real clean time I've ever had without using illicit substances.
I'm 4 weeks sober, 28 days yeah yeah! Mom took me out to dinner to celebrate which was pretty cool. I'm clean another day and thankful for that!

I know I can stay sober one more day, and it's my hope you all will too! It was really nice not thinking, "oh I've got dope money!" but rather I'm going to go walk around the mall and get a coffee. It almost seemed like fate.

But, I am clean, and life is good! Weather you're just starting off, restarting, or you have years of clean time, stay clean just for today. Don't give up on yourself, and keep your eye on that prize!
Trying to move forward, and have another day sober under my belt.

I've hemmed and hauled about weather or not to go, but after getting advice from my IOP group, NA home group, and therapists; I have decided to go. All my friends know I am in recovery and will not be drinking with them.

It's day 59 for me. Yesterday I had a big surprise; I graduated from IOP! ... So now I have my certificate, and I, feeling pretty good! My continuing care group is awesome! A lot of them have been with the group for 1-2 years so they have a really good bond.
How are you doing today? Weather you have years, months, days, or hours clean or even if you just have the desire to stop using post up and tell us.
I'm at 105 days today... Been in a bit of a funk since right around my 90 days clean. Having extremely vivid bad dreams, or drug dreams, 4/7 night a week.
I'm extremely thankful for my sobriety. It's been a true struggle for me to get to this point.

I have been able to see friends I've made over these past four years and from before. I have been able to go to sporting events, even spending hundreds on a game. I have been in and lost relationships. I have made friends and lost some. I have built such strong connections to people. I have been able to have successes and failures. I have been able to save money, invest and look forward to a future that has infinite possibility. I have been able to rebuild relationships with my family.
